metadata.titel_preek: The Cry Heard In The Land

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement of a marginalized community toward justice and resurrection through the imitation of Christ's suffering and reliance on divine power.

subject.identificatie: The Community ('We' / 'Some people' / 'Our fathers and mothers')
tekstueel_bewijs: Our fathers and mothers hummed softly
Some people... have entrusted their lives
Some people... have challenged the conscience of the world
righteousness finds its way to resurrection

zender.identificatie: The Moral Sanity of the Universe / God's Word
tekstueel_bewijs: commitment to the moral sanity of the universe
reliance upon God's word and God's promises

ontvanger.identificatie: The World / All segments of society
tekstueel_bewijs: never a way of particularism for the special benefits of any one segment
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject (the committed community).

helper.identificatie: The Power not our own / The Sword of the Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: a power not our own which makes for righteousness
helper.rol_van_god: God is primarily the Helper (Adjuvant) who empowers the human Subject.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help/instrument ('sword') used by the Subject.

tegenstander.identificatie: Overwhelming odds / Oppressive structures (implied by 'slave quarters' and 'Pilate')
tekstueel_bewijs: kept us firm against overwhelming odds
those who jammed the reed in mockery
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is both historical (slavery/segregation) and spiritual (mockery of Christ's reign).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The historical work of Jesus on the Cross as the archetype for the primary program.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Jesus
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The work of Jesus is presented as the pattern which the Montgomery community is currently 'participating' in or replicating.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Sword of Spirit → The Community ← Overwhelming Odds

voorbeelden: Such must be the faith of Christians!
The moment we stop believing... we have suspended participation
entrusted their lives and their fortunes
with a sense of high destiny
a power not our own which makes for righteousness

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Will' and 'Commitment' of the believers to align with a pre-existing moral power.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the universality of the Cross—it is a path open to all who 'believe' and 'commit'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; Calvary is the necessary passage for the Subject.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses high Christological language, the actantial subject is frequently the community 'participating' or 'committing'. It leans toward a 'Participationist' model where human agency is the engine of the narrative movement.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The moment we stop believing... we have suspended our participation

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: a power not our own which makes for righteousness

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is the supreme exemplar of the 'way of Calvary' which the community now follows.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Instead of 'We face Calvary like Jesus,' a theocentric reading would be 'Jesus faces our Calvary for us when we cannot.'

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification (the secondary program) is fused with Justification (the primary program).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Highly coherent as a narrative of social-spiritual struggle.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'power not our own' and the heavy emphasis on 'our commitment'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: suspended our participation in the life of Christ

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'sword' used by the soul to challenge the world.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Serious; it requires the 'likeness of his death' to overcome.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a powerful narrative of communal agency. However, the 'engine' of the story is the community's commitment rather than God's initiative.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The community is the subject of 'finding the way to resurrection'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make the 'Power not our own' the subject that carries the community.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Righteousness finds its way to resurrection by facing Calvary,' use 'God carries righteousness through the fire of Calvary to the glory of resurrection.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Receiver' of the love mentioned in John 3:16.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the 'simple souls' did not just fill the air with hosannas, but were first filled by the grace of the one walking the path.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Expand on how the 'power not our own' actually operates when human 'vouloir' fails.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (injustice/mockery) is already well-defined and serious.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon successfully avoids 'cheap grace' by acknowledging the cost of the struggle.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'Secondary Program' (Ethics/Montgomery struggle) often overshadows the 'Primary Program' (God's act in Christ).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Ground the community's commitment explicitly in the prior, finished work of the Subject (God).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A rhetorically magnificent text that masterfully links the biblical narrative to contemporary struggle, though it risks making human commitment the condition for divine life.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'I have a dream' style cadences; Greimas reveals that the 'We' is the one doing the heavy lifting, not God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would look at the context of John 3:16; Greimas looks at how John 3:16 is used as a 'Sender' of values for the Montgomery Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'participation' is used here as a modal competence (vouloir-faire) rather than a purely mystical union.

volledige_object_lijst: participation in the life of Christ
appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Exemplarist Participation'—Christ is the map, and the community are the travelers.
